name: BEST WESTERN Plus Newark Airport West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Outside it is in an industrial area. Great if you need just a place to sleep before or after flights but there is no place to go otherwise. Inside it's a nice looking hotel and the rooms also look upgraded. Beds were comfortable. They seem to be having a little problem with maintenence. We stayed twice (once coming once going) and both times the toilet malfunctioned. Some of the lights flickered - not sure why, the coffee maker was non-functional, and it was a very long wait for hot water to come out of the shower. The front desk staff was excellent, especially Steve.
reviews.title: Served its purpose - flight in and out of Newark

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here one night and left our car for 5 days, with the park and fly package. When making the reservation we were assured that the car would be left in a secure monitored lot. What they actually do is jockey the cars around in the street in front of the hotel. When we came back from our trip, there was a large dent with cracked paint on the front corner of our car! THe manager said to sent him a quote for repairs and now will not return any of my calls or emails. The front desk says he is always unavailable when I call. I understand that accidents happen, but I would expect that the hotel would address the problem, instead of refusing to talk to me about it. DO NOT TRUST THESE GUYS WITH YOUR CAR! It is much safter and about the same price to leave your car in one of the many lots around the airport.
reviews.title: DO NOT LEAVE YOUR CAR HERE!!

reviews.text: We decided to book a "stay, park, and fly" package at this Newark Airport-area hotel because we had a very early morning flight and live about 90 minutes from the airport. We were pleased with the price of $189.99 for a room, a light breakfast, and parking for 9 days.
reviews.title: Mediocre hotel with bad service

reviews.text: When we arrived, we were given our room keys and asked to leave our car keys so that the lot attendant could move our car to a secured lot. We didn't give it a second thought. We then went to our room, which was clean, spacious, and nicely decorated. However, every time someone used the toilet, my husband had to lift the tank lid and stop it from running. Secondly, the air conditioning didn't work well and when it did turn on, it made an immense amount of noise. (When we mentioned this, we were told that the air conditioner had to "reset" once in a while.) Nonetheless, we got a few hours sleep. In the morning, the "light breakfast" for all of those hopping on the early shuttles was a very small tray of corn muffins and a few apples and oranges. We passed and opted to eat at the airport.
reviews.title: Nice hotel near the cruise ports.

reviews.text: Anyway, when we returned 9 days later to retrieve our car, we were quite surprised to see that the driver side window was covered with plastic. Apparently, it had fallen into the door and couldn't be retrieved. (It appeared as if someone tried to take the door panel apart to fix it.) This problem apparently occurred when the car was moved on the night we stayed at the hotel. However, we were NEVER notified that there was a problem with the car. Even if we had already left, a courtesy call would have been in order as the hotel had our cell phone number and could have easily reached us. So, we drove the 90 minutes home in the rain. When asked about the problem with the window, the night manager simply offered a perplexed look. Obviously, the window malfunction was not their fault but a call to us was certainly in order. Perhaps we could have arranged to have it fixed while we were gone.
reviews.title: Fine for an overnight stay

reviews.text: After a fiasco with Continental (never again will we use them), we picked blindly from the hotel board in the airport and came up with this Best Western.Our driver told us that a large part of their guests are Continental flyers, and I don't doubt it ,worse airline in the world!! Location is near the airport but in a very highly industrial zone. Room are nice and clean but you can tell this is a very old hotel with new interiors, thin walls , old bathrooms. But the rate was good and the onsite restaurant (Thank god because there is NOTHING near here), was quite good and the bartender pours a mean drink. All in all if your stuck for a night look this place up otherwise I would stay elsewhere. .
reviews.title: OK if Continental Airlines messes up your trip.

reviews.text: We have just returned from a week in New York staying at the Best Western Newark Airport West. We found the staff very friendly and helpful - especially the reception guys! The rooms are large, clean and comfortable - plenty of hot water and fluffy towels, microwave, fridge, TV, free wifi and breakfast. The breakfast was a good deal with a fair choice of hot and cold food, decent fruit juices and hot drinks. We ate in the restaurant on some evenings. Menue is somewhat limited and not that cheap but it was enjoyable and staff were pleasant.
reviews.title: A good hotel - Ideal if you fly into Newark Airport

reviews.text: We chose the hotel because the price was good and it offers a free shuttle (Mercedes Minibus) to and from the airport. When you arrive at the airport you take the air-train to P4 and as you exit use one of the free phones to call the hotel (You just push the button for Best Western Newark West). There is a free shuttle to Newark Penn Station at 7, 8, 9,10 and 11 (am and pm). You just go to reception at these times to travel to the station but note it will only pick you up from the station if you call at least 15 minutes before the hour. Outside of these times you can pay for the shuttle $12.50 per room. You can also have it take you to the Jersey Garden Outlet Mall for $25 return per room. It is a really good place to pick up designer clothes at reasonable prices.
reviews.title: Dirty and no parking

reviews.text: There are a lot of criticisms about the shuttle in other reports and some are justified. However I feel some of the comments made about the drivers are a bit harsh. Some of them are fairly chatty and some are quiet but I would point out that all are safe and polite. If you call about half-hour before you need the shuttle (the number is on your room key) you should get the shuttle without any problems but if it does not arrive within 10 minutes of the promised time call again. (50 cents from inside the station).
reviews.title: Ok for one night, poor breakfast, thin walls.

reviews.text: We travelled into New York on the PATH train each day to the World Trade Centre on a 10 trip ticket - good value at $13 (otherwise $1.75 a single journey). You can also get a Week-long Metro ticket (unlimited journeys) for $29 but there is no great saving over paying per trip.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.text: Breakfast was OK. Nothing special. WiFI in our room was OK (2nd floor) and in the lobby & restaurant.
reviews.title: Nice large rooms and good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean and spacious. The airconditioning was working good and the room was not smelly. We had a double queen room. Beds are OK.
reviews.title: Don't judge it by the outside or the surroundings

reviews.text: Nice large TV which you can watch when lying in bed. You could watch from both beds. TV was centered between them.
reviews.title: Great alternative to the high priced NYC hotels!

reviews.text: The bathroom/toilet was a bit small, but clean. There is a coffeemaker in the bathroom, which I found a bit weird and strange place.
reviews.title: Big Turn Off

reviews.text: The surrounding of the hotel is not nice. Like others say, very industrial. No nice view out of your room. But well, I was not there to stay in my room. It was just to sleep and the whole day you are gone. So for that purpose it was a good hotel for a reasonable price.
reviews.title: Near by Airport

reviews.text: I used my miles to stay at this airport hotel. I've stayed at the Sheraton Newark before and I'd say Sheraton deserves quite a better rating than this hotel. Hotel staff is quite friendly and very responsive to my requests in general. Rooms were ok though the choice of food is very limited and mostly deep fried with meat (not my style)
reviews.title: ok room though very limited choice of food and nothing nearby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK for a night stay close to the airport. Ideal for passengers in transit. Due to the limited choice of things to do around here, I'd prolli stay in the city if I wanted to explore new york. However, its nice that they have free wifi for all hotel guests; not all hotels offer that.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place to stay near airport. Have stayed in a number of others using Priceline, but the $10 for this and $18 for that moved the total well above the $120 mark. Both Priceline and Travelocity have King room for $80 plus tax. That included everything - Hot breakfast, Internet, parking and a very nice room hotel. You won't get the big atrium the Sheraton has, but the rooms are as nice (Ours was actually nicer) Marble bathroom, Flat screen TV, micro - frig.
reviews.title: Good Hotel for the price paid

reviews.text: All was good about this hotel except the limited parking. I arrives late had to park my car on the road side outside the hotel and eventhe staff were helpless on this. Breakfast was hot, rooms were clean and good. Overall a good hotel in Newark for the price paid.
reviews.title: Great Help

reviews.text: Here for a class in hotel. Nice very large room. Used frig and microwave; both worked great.
reviews.title: Snowed in!!!

aka: Best Western Plus Newark Airport West Hotel
description: Welcome to BEST WESTERN PLUS Newark Airport West!Stay at this conveniently located Newark hotel and enjoy full-service amenities and easy access to New York City!The BEST WESTERN PLUS Newark Airport West offers travelers the conveniences and services of any full-service hotel without inflated nightly rates normally found in the New York area. Unique hotel amenities include a daily complimentary hot buffet breakfast, and an exercise facility. A convenient 24-hour business center and a 24-hour snack shop are located on-site, perfect for travelers arriving and departing at irregular hours. A recently renovated, on-site cocktail lounge offers a wide array of spirits and allows weary travelers to unwind.Accommodation amenities include an in-room microwave, refrigerator and an iron/ironing board. The BEST WESTERN PLUS Newark Airport West also offers same day dry cleaning service.A complimentary shuttle service is available for guests to Newark International Airport. Hotel guests can also take advantage of a daily shuttle to the Jersey Garden Outlet Mall and Penn Station-offering easy access to the sights and attractions of New York City. Shuttle service is also available to the Cape Liberty Cruise Port, located in nearby Bayonne. Guests can also take advantage of our "Park and Fly" package where you can stay one night and park a car for up to 10 days.
